turns.speaker: BASQUIAT
turns.text: Do you know what he's saying?

turns.speaker: GINA
turns.text: What who's saying?

turns.speaker: BASQUIAT
turns.text: Manzanita....  ... if one day I die, and you read this piece of paper, I want you to know how much I love you. Although I'll never see you again, Gypsy, Gypsy, your hair, your hair, your face, your face'

turns.speaker: BASQUIAT
turns.text: ... What's the matter?

turns.speaker: GINA
turns.text: Oh, God, Basquiat, you scared the shit out of me. How the fuck could you do that to yourself?

turns.speaker: BASQUIAT
turns.text: You're back.

turns.speaker: GINA
turns.text: It's Monday morning.

turns.speaker: BASQUIAT
turns.text: It's not Sunday? I missed you. You shouldn't leave me alone.

turns.speaker: GINA
turns.text: You're blaming me? I had to go see my family.

turns.speaker: BASQUIAT
turns.text: I'm your family.

turns.speaker: GINA
turns.text: Basquiat, what did you take?

turns.speaker: GINA
turns.text: Basquiat, don't lie.  This is smack.

turns.speaker: BASQUIAT
turns.text: You want some?

turns.speaker: BASQUIAT
turns.text: You look fucking beautiful, beautiful.

turns.speaker: GINA
turns.text: Well thanks!

turns.speaker: BASQUIAT
turns.text: Which island of Hawaii do you want our house to be on? Maui? Kaui? Molokai?

turns.speaker: GINA
turns.text: I hadn't thought about it.

turns.speaker: BASQUIAT
turns.text: Oahu, Lanai, Niihau, Kahoolawee 

turns.speaker: GINA
turns.text: Staten Island would be ok.

turns.speaker: GINA
turns.text: It looks done.

turns.speaker: BASQUIAT
turns.text: Think so?

turns.speaker: BASQUIAT
turns.text: ... babies.

turns.speaker: GINA
turns.text: You mean babies with you?

turns.speaker: BASQUIAT
turns.text: What's wrong with me?

turns.speaker: GINA
turns.text: You're your own baby.

turns.speaker: GINA
turns.text: Hi.

turns.speaker: BASQUIAT
turns.text: Hi.

turns.speaker: GINA
turns.text: What's that?

turns.speaker: BASQUIAT
turns.text: A present I picked up for you.

turns.speaker: GINA
turns.text: So are you really friends with Andy? He seems like such a weirdo.

turns.speaker: BASQUIAT
turns.text: He's not. He's out of town and he calls me every day. What's weird about him?

turns.speaker: GINA
turns.text: Don't you think he's using you?

turns.speaker: BASQUIAT
turns.text: Why does everybody say that? He's the only person I know who doesn't need to use me.

turns.speaker: GINA
turns.text: So. Are you ready? I start Columbia next fall. Of course, there's like, a year of pre-med stuff, but  whatever. I'm really excited.  And: Rene gave me a job as his secretary. His poems are getting published.

turns.speaker: BASQUIAT
turns.text: How is he?

turns.speaker: GINA
turns.text: Pretty much the same.

turns.speaker: BASQUIAT
turns.text: Wow. Congratulations. I hate that asshole.  Thanks for coming. I guess I just wanted to find out how you're 

turns.speaker: GINA
turns.text: What's that about?

turns.speaker: BASQUIAT
turns.text: Forget it.

turns.speaker: GINA
turns.text: That is amazing. What year is it?

turns.speaker: BASQUIAT
turns.text: George?

turns.speaker: BASQUIAT
turns.text: Baby, I think about you a lot. I'm really sorry about everything. You have to believe me. I'm serious. I wish, y'know, that we were 

turns.speaker: GINA
turns.text: I don't believe it, Jean  they're picking straws.

turns.speaker: GINA
turns.text: You don't have to be sorry. There's no one to blame. Jean, you're a real artist. I thought I was one. You made me realize I wasn't.

turns.speaker: BASQUIAT
turns.text: What's his name?

turns.speaker: BASQUIAT
turns.text: I'll take three big Macs, two chocolate shakes, two orders of fries, and an apple pie.

turns.speaker: COUNTERMAN
turns.text: You want three Big Macs, two chocolate shakes, two orders of fries, and an apple pie.

turns.speaker: BASQUIAT
turns.text: Forget it .I'll take six, no, seven chocolate shakes, an order of fries, a Big Mac, and two apple pies.

turns.speaker: COUNTERMAN
turns.text: You only want one Big Mac?

turns.speaker: BASQUIAT
turns.text: Is that the best quality you have?

turns.speaker: COUNTERMAN
turns.text: Yeah, it's the best one.

turns.speaker: BASQUIAT
turns.text: I'll take the whole tin.

turns.speaker: COUNTERMAN
turns.text: It's three thousand dollars!

turns.speaker: BASQUIAT
turns.text: I'll take it.  Andy, gimme three thousand dollars.  Just the caviar  I'll get the rest.

turns.speaker: DRIVER
turns.text: I really... admire you.

turns.speaker: BASQUIAT
turns.text: Me? Why?

turns.speaker: DRIVER
turns.text: You did it! You made it. I'm a painter, too.

turns.speaker: BASQUIAT
turns.text: That's great.

turns.speaker: DRIVER
turns.text: Would you check out my studio some time?

turns.speaker: BASQUIAT
turns.text: Sure. I'd be glad to.

turns.speaker: BASQUIAT
turns.text: What's your name, man?

turns.speaker: DRIVER
turns.text: They call me Steve, but I prefer Shenge.

turns.speaker: BASQUIAT
turns.text: Nice to meet you, Shenge. Want a job?

turns.speaker: STELLA
turns.text: Hi.

turns.speaker: BASQUIAT
turns.text: Hi.

turns.speaker: STELLA
turns.text: I've seen you before. I like your paintings a lot. Your hair was different.

turns.speaker: BASQUIAT
turns.text: You like your dad's paintings?

turns.speaker: STELLA
turns.text: Some of them.

turns.speaker: BASQUIAT
turns.text: Stand still.

turns.speaker: BASQUIAT
turns.text: See you later.

turns.speaker: STELLA
turns.text: Thanks

turns.speaker: BIG PINK
turns.text: How can I ever thank you?

turns.speaker: BASQUIAT
turns.text: I'd like to squeeze your titties.

turns.speaker: BIG PINK
turns.text: Come on.

turns.speaker: BASQUIAT
turns.text: Wanna Mac?

turns.speaker: BIG PINK
turns.text: No, I'd like the scarf.

turns.speaker: BASQUIAT
turns.text: Have a Mac.

turns.speaker: BIG PINK
turns.text: I don't eat junk food.

turns.speaker: BASQUIAT
turns.text: Oh. I didn't know. I'll take you to the best restaurant in town.  You'll miss a great meal and I'll keep the scarf, anyway. What's your name?

turns.speaker: BIG PINK
turns.text: You're a fast mover.

turns.speaker: BASQUIAT
turns.text: No name? That's ok. I'll just call you Big Pink.

turns.speaker: CHRIS
turns.text: That's a beautiful name. French?

turns.speaker: BASQUIAT
turns.text: Haitian. I'm going to kill myself. I'm taking pills. Reds, blues, greens.

turns.speaker: CHRIS
turns.text: What? Wait a minute... talk to me.

turns.speaker: BASQUIAT
turns.text: Life doesn't... make... sense. This city's k-killing me. I want my liquid hijack Marlboros!

turns.speaker: CHRIS
turns.text: What? Life's beautiful. Depression isn't permanent. Don't you believe that?  What is it  did your girlfriend leave you?

turns.speaker: BASQUIAT
turns.text: No! I have a boyfriend. He loves me.

turns.speaker: CHRIS
turns.text: You see? You have someone to live for.

turns.speaker: BASQUIAT
turns.text: No, I don't. I'm alone. We all are. Especially here. The world's unjust. The respect fools get. The disrespect I get.

turns.speaker: CHRIS
turns.text: What is it you want? Respect? I have respect for you, just for making this call. One philosopher said "Sadness is a sin against the richness of the world." Think about it. Feel it.

turns.speaker: BASQUIAT
turns.text: You don't even know me. I want real respect.

turns.speaker: CHRIS
turns.text: What? What do you want?

turns.speaker: BASQUIAT
turns.text: Fame. My liquid hijack Marlboros and the moon and the cow that jumped over it.

turns.speaker: RENE
turns.text: You heard of Albert Milo. I made that niggah. I'm Rene Ricard. Didn't you read "Not About Albert Milo?" I know who to hype. Baby, I'm gonna make you a star.

turns.speaker: BASQUIAT
turns.text: Can you put me in the ring with him?

turns.speaker: RENE
turns.text: I can put you in the ring with him. Even book the dates.  But those big boys know how to fight. They could make you look real sissy.  I was looking at that painting upstairs. It's the first time a picture made me embarrassed to own anything.  So what's your real name? 'Samo?'

turns.speaker: BASQUIAT
turns.text: Jean Michel Basquiat.

turns.speaker: RENE
turns.text: Uh huhh... Band practice?  It's Benny. He wants to know why you're not at band practice...?

turns.speaker: BASQUIAT
turns.text: Fuck...  I forgot about that.

turns.speaker: RENE
turns.text: Fuck band practice... If you're gonna be a painter you're gonna have to break a few hearts  you don't wanna be like Tony Bennett..

turns.speaker: BASQUIAT
turns.text: Tony Bennett... What do you mean?

turns.speaker: RENE
turns.text: Singing on stage and painting in your spare time.

turns.speaker: BASQUIAT
turns.text: I didn't know Tony Bennett painted.

turns.speaker: RENE
turns.text: My point exactly.

turns.speaker: RENE
turns.text: So keep painting.

turns.speaker: BASQUIAT
turns.text: Yes, Boss.  If you're so smart, why are you here with me in this basement?

turns.speaker: RENE
turns.text: You're news. I want the scoop. I write it down. When I speak, no one believes me. But when I write it down, people know it's true.  There's never been a black painter in art history that's been considered really important, you know?

turns.speaker: BASQUIAT
turns.text: So what?

turns.speaker: RENE
turns.text: So shut up and keep painting..

turns.speaker: BASQUIAT
turns.text: What time is it?

turns.speaker: BASQUIAT
turns.text: That one's for you.

turns.speaker: RENE
turns.text: Thanks... I'll take it tonight.

turns.speaker: BASQUIAT
turns.text: I can't. After the show.

turns.speaker: RENE
turns.text: You fucking little whore! You sold my painting! I'm gonna tell you something, brother  when you're climbing up the ladder of success, don't kick out the rungs! Believe that shit.

turns.speaker: BASQUIAT
turns.text: I'll make you another one.

turns.speaker: RENE
turns.text: Forget it.

turns.speaker: BASQUIAT
turns.text: Hey, Rene.

turns.speaker: RENE
turns.text: Thanks again for not inviting me. I'm only here on business.

turns.speaker: GREG
turns.text: Jean, could you get me a Phillips screwdriver?

turns.speaker: BASQUIAT
turns.text: A what?

turns.speaker: GREG
turns.text: A Phillips head. From the toolbox.

turns.speaker: BASQUIAT
turns.text: Yeah.

turns.speaker: BASQUIAT
turns.text: 'Phillips head,' right?

turns.speaker: GREG
turns.text: Yeah.

turns.speaker: BASQUIAT
turns.text: You don't have any!!!

turns.speaker: GREG
turns.text: That's impossible. I've got, like, five of 'em!

turns.speaker: GREG
turns.text: Jean? Hold this, please.  You'll get there. But it's good to have something to fall back on. That's why I became an electrician. It pays the rent. Y'know, I'm an artist, too.

turns.speaker: BASQUIAT
turns.text: I didn't know.

turns.speaker: GREG
turns.text: I sculpt. I'm really just starting to find myself. How old are you? Twenty? You're just like I used to be. I'm forty-one. And I'm glad I haven't gotten any recognition. It gave me time to develop.

turns.speaker: LESHKO
turns.text: OK! Goodbye!

turns.speaker: GINA
turns.text: Pipe down, Lech. Let him order.

turns.speaker: LESHKO
turns.text: You nuts? Let him order? You on his side? You're not such a good waitress. You get out, too.

turns.speaker: GINA
turns.text: I just don't think you're being fair.

turns.speaker: LESHKO
turns.text: I need this?

turns.speaker: GINA
turns.text: I need this?

turns.speaker: TOXIC
turns.text: YO! Jean, this is Ramellzee.

turns.speaker: RAMMELLZEE
turns.text: Yo... You know why Rammellzee's here, don't you?

turns.speaker: TOXIC
turns.text: Uh-oh!

turns.speaker: RAMMELLZEE
turns.text: I'm here for an interrogation. You've been called a graffiti artist and I wanna know why. All I see are scribble scrabble abstractions!

turns.speaker: TOXIC
turns.text: Man, I was up on him years ago on the IRT.

turns.speaker: RAMMELLZEE
turns.text: You're selling and ending the culture. Not one bit of information. Only to get the money and growl with the power, man.

turns.speaker: TOXIC
turns.text: That's ignorant.

turns.speaker: ALFRED
turns.text: Mr. Wayne ... Something wrong?

turns.speaker: BRUCE
turns.text: No, nothing, ah ...  His parents ... I ... I hope he finds them.

turns.speaker: BRUCE
turns.text: It's cold.

turns.speaker: ALFRED
turns.text: It's vichyssoise, sir.

turns.speaker: BRUCE
turns.text: Vichyssoise.  Supposed to be cold, right?

turns.speaker: ALFRED
turns.text: I suppose you feel better now, sir.

turns.speaker: BRUCE
turns.text: No, actually I feel worse.

turns.speaker: BRUCE
turns.text: Sorry, Alfred, I have to get to the Plaza.  You heard Penguin, he was practically begging me to show.

turns.speaker: ALFRED
turns.text: Which is why I hoped you'd snub him.

turns.speaker: BRUCE
turns.text: 'Fraid I can't.  There's been a kidnapping ... Tell Selina ... Ms. Kyle ... that some business came up -- no, tell her some major deal fell through, she'll feel sorry ... No, no, here's what to do, just tell her ... let her know that I ... not in a dumb "Be my girlfriend way," but --

turns.speaker: ALFRED
turns.text: I will relay the message.

turns.speaker: BRUCE
turns.text: Alright, thanks.

turns.speaker: BRUCE
turns.text: Selina ... more facets than Vicki, huh?  Funny, but sort of mysterious...

turns.speaker: BRUCE
turns.text: "Affair" ... yes, maybe ... if she ...

turns.speaker: ALFRED
turns.text: I think I'll take the stairs.

turns.speaker: ALFRED
turns.text: Mr. Wayne ... a reminder:  Tonight is that loathsome party, hosted by that odious Mr. Shreck.  May we RSVP in the resoundingly negative?

turns.speaker: BRUCE
turns.text: I'm tempted, but ... well ... it is an occasion for celebration, and ... umm ... Selina will probably be there ...

turns.speaker: ALFRED
turns.text: Ah.  "Who", may I ask, are you going "as"?

turns.speaker: BRUCE
turns.text: You'll never guess.

turns.speaker: BRUCE
turns.text: I guess this mean we won.

turns.speaker: ALFRED
turns.text: Yes, I suppose that we did.

turns.speaker: ALFRED
turns.text: Well ... Come what may... Merry Christmas, Mr. Wayne.

turns.speaker: BRUCE
turns.text: Right.  Sure.  And "Peace on earth, good will toward men."

turns.speaker: CATWOMAN
turns.text: Where's the fire?

turns.speaker: BATMAN
turns.text: "Shreck's."  You --

turns.speaker: CATWOMAN
turns.text: How could you?  I'm a woman...

turns.speaker: BATMAN
turns.text: I'm -- sorry, I --

turns.speaker: CATWOMAN
turns.text: As I was saying:  I'm a woman, and can't be taken for granted.  Are you listening, you Batman you?

turns.speaker: BATMAN
turns.text: Hanging on every word.

turns.speaker: CATWOMAN
turns.text: Good joke.  Wanna hear another one?

turns.speaker: BATMAN
turns.text: A "he-man"?  Sure.  They shine that beacon in the sky, then wonder what hole I crawl out of.

turns.speaker: CATWOMAN
turns.text: Wow, a real response and you're not even trying to get into my tights. But explain me ... If you're so down on "them" out there, why bust your bat-buns to protect 'em?

turns.speaker: BATMAN
turns.text: I just can't sleep at night. Exploding department stores keep me up.  One ...

turns.speaker: CATWOMAN
turns.text: I can't sleep either, lately.  A little link, between us.  But bottom line baby, you live to preserve the peace, and I'm dying to disturb it.  That could put a strain on our relationship.

turns.speaker: BATMAN
turns.text: ...four, five.

turns.speaker: CATWOMAN
turns.text: Hey stud:  I thought we had something together.

turns.speaker: BATMAN
turns.text: We do.

turns.speaker: BATMAN
turns.text: A kiss under the misteltoe. Mistletoe can be deadly, if you eat it ...

turns.speaker: CATWOMAN
turns.text: But a kiss can be even deadlier, if you mean it.

turns.speaker: CATWOMAN
turns.text: You're the second man who killed me this week.  But hey, no prob ... I've got seven lives left.

turns.speaker: BATMAN
turns.text: I tried to grab you -- save you --

turns.speaker: CATWOMAN
turns.text: Seems like every woman you try to save ends up dead, or deeply resentful.

turns.speaker: BATMAN
turns.text: First you're gonna shut up.  Then you're gonna turn yourself in.

turns.speaker: CATWOMAN
turns.text: Don't be naive.  The law doesn't apply to people like him!  Or us --

turns.speaker: BATMAN
turns.text: Wrong on both counts.

turns.speaker: BATMAN
turns.text: Admiring your handiwork?

turns.speaker: PENGUIN
turns.text: Touring the riot scene.  Gravely assessing the devastation. Upstanding mayor stuff.

turns.speaker: BATMAN
turns.text: You're not the Mayor.

turns.speaker: PENGUIN
turns.text: Things change.  Hey, good to meet you.  We'll be working hand in glove in Gotham's glorious future.

turns.speaker: BATMAN
turns.text: Once you were their freak, now these clowns do your bidding. Must feel pretty good.

turns.speaker: PENGUIN
turns.text: Better than you know, Bat-boy.

turns.speaker: BATMAN
turns.text: What're you really after?

turns.speaker: PENGUIN
turns.text: Ah, the direct approach.  I admire that in a man with a mask.  But you don't really think you'll ever win, playing it your way ..?

turns.speaker: BATMAN
turns.text: Things change.

turns.speaker: PENGUIN
turns.text: I think you're jealous that I'm a genuine freak, and you have to wear a mask!

turns.speaker: BATMAN
turns.text: Maybe you're right.

turns.speaker: BRUCE
turns.text: We've met.

turns.speaker: SELINA
turns.text: Have we?

turns.speaker: BRUCE
turns.text: Sorry.  I mistook me for somebody else.

turns.speaker: SELINA
turns.text: You mean mistook <u>me</u>?

turns.speaker: BRUCE
turns.text: Didn't I say that?

turns.speaker: SELINA
turns.text: Yes and no ...

turns.speaker: SELINA
turns.text: You don't seem like the type who does business with Mr. Shreck.

turns.speaker: BRUCE
turns.text: No.  And you don't seem like the type who takes orders from him.

turns.speaker: SELINA
turns.text: Well that's a ... long story ...

turns.speaker: BRUCE
turns.text: Well, I could ... free up some time...

turns.speaker: SELINA
turns.text: I'm listed.

turns.speaker: BRUCE
turns.text: I'm tempted.

turns.speaker: SELINA
turns.text: Pouring myself into my work.

turns.speaker: BRUCE
turns.text: I, ah ... didn't catch your last name.

turns.speaker: SELINA
turns.text: Oh.  "Kyle."

turns.speaker: BRUCE
turns.text: Selina.  Hi.  Didn't mean to --

turns.speaker: SELINA
turns.text: Scare me?  No, actually, I was just scaring myself ...

turns.speaker: BRUCE
turns.text: I don't see how ... Anyway, it's a treat to find you out in the world, away from Ebeneezer Shreck.

turns.speaker: SELINA
turns.text: Treat to be here.

turns.speaker: SELINA
turns.text: The news these days ... weird. People looking to superheroes for their peace of mind, and blaming their problems on super-villains ... instead of themselves, or their spouses at least.

turns.speaker: BRUCE
turns.text: And it's not even accurate ... I mean, "Batman Blows It"?  The guy probably prevented <u>millions</u> in property damage.

turns.speaker: SELINA
turns.text: I heard on TV, "Catwoman is thought to weigh 140 pounds."  How do these hacks <u>sleep</u> at night?

turns.speaker: SELINA
turns.text: You're not coming to that, are you?  "The Relighting of the Tree" thing?

turns.speaker: BRUCE
turns.text: I wouldn't be caught dead.  No, it's probably how I would be caught.  The Mayor stupidly took Cobblepot's bait --

turns.speaker: SELINA
turns.text: -- and it's gonna be a hot time in the cold town tonight.

turns.speaker: BRUCE
turns.text: You almost sound enthusiastic.

turns.speaker: SELINA
turns.text: I detest violence, but ... Christmas complacency can be a downer, too.

turns.speaker: BRUCE
turns.text: You've got a dark side, Selina Kyle.

turns.speaker: SELINA
turns.text: No darker than yours, Bruce.

turns.speaker: BRUCE
turns.text: Well, I'm... braver at night, if that's what you mean...

turns.speaker: SELINA
turns.text: Yeah?  Me too...

turns.speaker: BRUCE
turns.text: ... Maybe I'll watch it on TV.

turns.speaker: SELINA
turns.text: "We"?  You and...

turns.speaker: BRUCE
turns.text: ... and me.  No, that's be me and me.  Is that what I said?

turns.speaker: SELINA
turns.text: Yes and no...

turns.speaker: SELINA
turns.text: I'm sure he's wonderful company and all, but ... doesn't the gold- plated bachelor bit get a little ... stale?

turns.speaker: BRUCE
turns.text: Somewhat like the lonesome secretary syndrome, I'd suppose.

turns.speaker: SELINA
turns.text: Executive Assistant.  Secretary.  Girlfriend?

turns.speaker: BRUCE
turns.text: Had one.  Didn't work.

turns.speaker: SELINA
turns.text: What went wrong?  Hang on, I think I know ... You kept things from her.

turns.speaker: BRUCE
turns.text: Nope, I told her everything.

turns.speaker: SELINA
turns.text: And the truth frightened her?

turns.speaker: BRUCE
turns.text: Well ... How can I put this. There were two truths ... and she had trouble reconciling them. Because <u>I</u> had trouble reconciling them.  Vicki said.

turns.speaker: SELINA
turns.text: "Vicki."  Ice-skater, or stewardess?

turns.speaker: BRUCE
turns.text: Photojournalist.

turns.speaker: SELINA
turns.text: Sure.

turns.speaker: SELINA
turns.text: Well?  Was "Vicki" right?  About your difficulty with duality?

turns.speaker: BRUCE
turns.text: If I said yes, then you might think me a Norman Bates, or a Ted Bundy type ... and then you might not let me kiss you.

turns.speaker: SELINA
turns.text: It's the so-called "normal" guys who always let you down.  Sickos never scare me.  At least they're commited.

turns.speaker: BRUCE
turns.text: Ah ... then you've come to the right lonely mansion.

turns.speaker: BRUCE
turns.text: I, ah ... never fool around on the first date.

turns.speaker: SELINA
turns.text: Nor I, on the second.

turns.speaker: BRUCE
turns.text: What're you doing three dates from now?

turns.speaker: BRUCE
turns.text: Sorry about yesterday ... Some big deal came together, no, fell through, and --

turns.speaker: SELINA
turns.text: 'S'okay, I had to go home, feed my cat.

turns.speaker: BRUCE
turns.text: No hard feelings?

turns.speaker: SELINA
turns.text: There's a big, comfy California King over in Bedding.  What say we ...

turns.speaker: BRUCE
turns.text: Y'mean take off our costumes?

turns.speaker: SELINA
turns.text: Guess I'm sick of wearing masks ...

turns.speaker: BRUCE
turns.text: Same here.  So why'd you come tonight?

turns.speaker: SELINA
turns.text: You first.

turns.speaker: SELINA
turns.text: Now don't give me a killing-Max- won't-solve-anything speech, because it will.  Aren't you tired of this sanctimonious robber baron always coming out on top?  When he should be six feet under?

turns.speaker: BRUCE
turns.text: Jesus, Selina, you're not the judge <u>or</u> the jury... I mean, just who do you think you <u>are</u>?

turns.speaker: SELINA
turns.text: I don't know anymore, Bruce ...

turns.speaker: SELINA
turns.text: A kiss under the mistletoe. Mistletoe can be deadly, if you eat it ...

turns.speaker: BRUCE
turns.text: But a kiss can be even deadlier, if you mean ... it.

turns.speaker: SELINA
turns.text: ... What do we do?

turns.speaker: BRUCE
turns.text: I don't know.  Till we figure it out, let's ... let's keep dancing.

turns.speaker: BRUCE
turns.text: Hmm.  Primitive ventilation.

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: Damn those Carny bolsheviks the other night, throwing bricks at my windows --

turns.speaker: BRUCE
turns.text: No.  No glass on the inside.

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: Weird, huh?

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: I'd offer you coffee, but my assistant is using her vacation time.

turns.speaker: BRUCE
turns.text: Good time, too.  Everyone but the bandits seem to be slacking off till after New Years'.

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: If my life has had any meaning, that's the meaning.

turns.speaker: BRUCE
turns.text: Max, I'm gonna fight you on this. The Mayor and I have already spoken and we see eye to eye here.  So --

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: Mayors come and go.  And heirs tire easily.  Really think a flyweight like you could last fifteen rounds with Muhammed Shreck.

turns.speaker: BRUCE
turns.text: I'm not scared of you, Max.

turns.speaker: BRUCE
turns.text: Not compared to that "Cobblepot" person you're promoting...

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: Scared of Oswald, are you?  Why, if his parents hadn't eighty- sixed him you two might've been roomies, at prep school!

turns.speaker: BRUCE
turns.text: "Oswald" is linked to the Red Triangle Gang.  I can't prove it but we both know it's true.

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: Wayne, I'll not stand for mud- slinging in this office.  If my assistant were here, she'd already have escorted you out, to --

turns.speaker: BRUCE
turns.text: What happened?

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: Yes, did -- did you injure yourself on that ski slope?  Is that why you cut short your vacation and came back?

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: Ingenious costume.  Let me guess ... Trust-fund goody-goody?

turns.speaker: BRUCE
turns.text: Course you're feeling fine ... You almost made a monster the Mayor of Gotham City.

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: I am the light of this city.  <u>And</u> I am its mean, twisted soul.  Does it really matter who's the "mayor"?

turns.speaker: BRUCE
turns.text: It does to me.

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: Yawn.

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: I don't know what you want, but I know I can get it for you with a minimum of fuss.  Money, jewels, a very big ball of string...

turns.speaker: CATWOMAN
turns.text: Your blood, Max.

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: My blood?  I ... I gave at the office.

turns.speaker: CATWOMAN
turns.text: A half-pint.  I'm talking gallons.

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: Let's make a deal.  <u>Other</u> than my blood, what can I off--

turns.speaker: CATWOMAN
turns.text: Sorry, Max.  A die for a die.

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: Either you've caught a cold, or you're planning to kill me.

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: Selina!  Selina Kyle!?  You're fired!  And Bruce -- Bruce Wayne! Why are you dressed up as Batman?

turns.speaker: CATWOMAN
turns.text: He <u>is</u> Batman, you moron.

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: Was.

turns.speaker: CATWOMAN
turns.text: You killed me, Batman killed me, Penguin killed me.  Three lives down.  Got enough bullets to finish me off?

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: One way to find out?

turns.speaker: PENGUIN
turns.text: I'll warm ya!  I got hot mitts --!

turns.speaker: CATWOMAN
turns.text: Down, Oswald.  We have to talk.  You see we've got something in common.

turns.speaker: PENGUIN
turns.text: Appetite for destruction? Contempt for the czars of fashion? Wait don't tell me ... Naked sexual charisma?

turns.speaker: CATWOMAN
turns.text: Batman.  The thorn in both our sides, the fly in our ointment.

turns.speaker: PENGUIN
turns.text: Huh?  You're implying I'm some kinda psycho criminal?

turns.speaker: PENGUIN
turns.text: Are you perchance a registered voter?  I'm also a mayoral prospect.

turns.speaker: CATWOMAN
turns.text: I have but one pet cause, today: Ban The Bat.

turns.speaker: PENGUIN
turns.text: Oh, him again.  He's already history -- check it out.

turns.speaker: PENGUIN
turns.text: We're gonna disassemble his spiffy old Batmobile, then reassemble it as an H-bomb on wheels.  Capiche? Yesterday's victor is tomorrow's vapor.

turns.speaker: CATWOMAN
turns.text: He'd have more power as a martyr. No, to destroy Batman we must first turn him into what he hates most.  Meaning, us.

turns.speaker: PENGUIN
turns.text: Y'mean frame him?

turns.speaker: CATWOMAN
turns.text: You're quick.  Mayor Cobblepot.

turns.speaker: PENGUIN
turns.text: Thanks.  Jeez.  Not used to this man-woman, cat-mouse business. Generally the babes flock to me, I tell 'em take a number.

turns.speaker: CATWOMAN
turns.text: You're off the hook, Ozzie.  But Batman is decidedly <u>not</u>.

turns.speaker: CATWOMAN
turns.text: He napalmed my arm.  He knocked me off a building just when I was starting to feel good about myself. I want to play an integral part in his degradation.

turns.speaker: PENGUIN
turns.text: Well, a plan <u>is</u> forming ... A vicious one, involving the loss of innocent life ...

turns.speaker: CATWOMAN
turns.text: I want in.  The thought of busting Batman makes me feel all ... dirty.  Maybe I'll give myself a bath right here ...

turns.speaker: PENGUIN
turns.text: Let's consummate our fiendish union!

turns.speaker: CATWOMAN
turns.text: I wouldn't touch you to scratch you.

turns.speaker: PENGUIN
turns.text: I oughta have you spayed!  You sent out all the signals!

turns.speaker: CATWOMAN
turns.text: Did I?  Only 'cause my mom trained me to, with a man... any man, all men --  Corn dog!

turns.speaker: CATWOMAN
turns.text: Me, domesticated?  By you?  I doubt it!  You repulsive... awful... <u>penguin</u>.

turns.speaker: PENGUIN
turns.text: The name is Oswald Cobblepot.

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: Son!

turns.speaker: CHIP
turns.text: Dad!  Save yourself!

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: I ... it was terrible, I leaned over, and accidentally knocked her, out --

turns.speaker: CHIP
turns.text: She jumped.  She'd been depressed.

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: Yes.  <u>Yes</u>.  Boyfriend trouble ..?

turns.speaker: CHIP
turns.text: PMS.

turns.speaker: CHIP
turns.text: You buy this "blurry" business?

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: Women... nothing surprises me, Chip. Excepting your late mother... Who even knew Selina had a brain to damage?  Bottom line:  she tries to blackmail us, we drop her out a higher window.  Meanwhile I got badder fish to fry.  Yeah -- Oswald, please.
